div.l: I wol aryse and aventuryn / by my fayth
Vnhardy vnsely / thus alle men sayth
And vp he ros / and softely forth he went
Vnto the cradel / and in his hond it hent
And bar it soft / vnto his beddis feet
Soone aftir the wyf hir routyng leet
And gan awake / and went hir out to pisse
And com agayn̄ / and gan hir cradill misse
And groped / heer and ther but she fond noon
Allas ꝙquod she / y hadde almost mys goon
I hadde almost gon / to the clerkys bed
Ey benedicite thanne hadde y evil sped
And forth she goth / tyl she the cradil fond
She gropeth alwey / ferthir wᵗyth hir hond
And fond the bed / and thouht nat but good
By cause that the cradyl / bi it stood
And nyst wher she was / for it was dyrk
But fair and wel / she crepte in to the Clerk
And lyth ful stylle / and wolde haue take a sleep
Wythynne a whyle that Iohn Clerk vp lep
And on this good wyf / he leid on sore
So mery a fit / ne hadde she ful yore
He prekyth harde / and depe as he wer͗e mad
This Ioly lyf / han these too clerkys lad
Tyl that the thridde cok / bi gan to syng
Aleyn wax wery / in the dawenynge
For he hadde swonkyn̄ / al the long nyht
He said farwell Malyn̄ swete wyht
The day is come / y may le le no lengir abide
But euyr mo / wher so y go or ryde
